title: PhD, Computational Hydrogeology
description_1: Published 6 scientific papers (3 first-author).
description_2: Tools used: R, Python, SQL, git/Github,  bash, AWS, cron, dplyr, ggplot2, shiny, flexdashboard, leaflet, sf, MODFLOW, RW3D, Paraview, Illustrator, ArcGIS, Envi, LaTeX
description_3: Won ~$153,000 in national, compeitive grants and awards from NASA, Microsoft AI for Earth, AGU, and others.

title: B.S., Integrative Biology (minor in Conflict Resolution)
description_1: NA

title: Research Assistant
description_1: Experimental design, data collection, data analysis, and writing of a report on invasive plant species in Berkeley's Strawbery Canyon.

title: Biological Research Assistant
description_1: Collected and managed field data to study intersection of fire, drought, and Phytophthora ramorum, the Sudden Oak Death agent.

title: Biological Research Assistant
description_1: Backpacked to remote alpine field sites to deploy temperature sensors, and study climate change impacts to on the American pika.
description_2: Identified & selected high-alpine field survey sites via satellite imagery.

title: Data Lab Researcher
description_1: NLP, text mining, and network analysis in R on a corpus of ~600 PDFs.
description_2: Developed a [R Shiny dashboard](https://richpauloo.shinyapps.io/cig_nlp) to understand the corpus.

title: Data Engineer
description_1: Developed a monitoring dashboard with interactive data visualization using AWS with R, SQL, Shiny, and Shiny Server. I also built an automated ETL pipeline that pulled data from an IoT sensor network to feed the dashboard. [REsults were peer-reviewed and published](https://doi.org/10.3390/w12041066).

title: Graduate Student Researcher
description_1: Process large hydrologic datasets, 3D numerical groundwater flow and contaminant transport models, & network optimization models.
description_2: Developed novel models of well failure, groundwater salinization, and contaminant transport in porous media.
description_3: Regularly use R, Python, Git, Bash, MODFLOW, RW3D, Paraview, Illustrator, AWS, Linux, ArcGIS, Envi, LaTeX.

title: Data Scientist
description_1: Built and automated ETL pipelines for ~180 real-time sensor networks and dashboards that process > 100,000 daily observations.
description_2: Turned messy data into actionable information and automated reports.
description_3: Tools used: R, Python, SQL, git/Github,  bash, AWS, cron, dplyr, ggplot2, shiny, flexdashboard, leaflet, sf
description_4: Managed multiple six-figure contracts, scoped work, contributed to strategic marketing, and trained staff.

title: Co-Founder
description_1: Manage $105k in annual contracts for specialized data science consulting.

title: Site Manager & Educator/Guide
description_1: Coordinated with Operations to run a 200-student, 60 employee campus, which involved frequent public speaking.
description_2: Lived and worked with a close team.
description_3: Trained in wilderness guiding and backcountry safety.
description_4: Served as primary liaison between the organization and clients.

title: Environmental Science Educator
loc: San Mateo County Office of Education
description_1: Designed cirriculum & taught science to diverse students.
description_2: Worked and lived with a close team of educators.
description_3: Frequent improvisational public speaking to large audiences.

title: Expedition Leader
description_1: Coordinated all aspects of multi-week international travel.
description_2: Facilitated teambuilding, group dynamics, and cultural integration.

title: Microsoft AI for Earth (national)
description_1: [gspdrywells.com](https://www.gspdrywells.com), AI-enabled forecasting of domestic well failure.

title: AGU Outstanding Student Presentation (national)
description_1: Awarded to the top 3-5% of presenters. [View presentation](https://www.richpauloo.com/talk/2019-agu/).

title: 2019 California Water Data Challenge (statewide)
description_1: Created [calwaterquality.com](http://calwaterquality.com), a statewide data portal that integrates and visualizes massive water quality data sets, and auto-generates water quality reports for more than 2,000 California public water systems.
description_2: [Blog post](https://www.richpauloo.com/post/cawdc-2019/) about the project summarizing my motivation.

title: NASA Data Visualization Competition (national)
description_1: [Machine learning for domestic well failure](https://www.richpauloo.com/talk/2018-nasa/).

title: 2018 California Water Data Challenge (statewide)
description_1: Used large state databases to build and calibrate a [predictive model](https://www.richpauloo.com/publication/well-failure/) of domestic well failure in California's Central Valley.
